heisigComment: * As a primitive, we shall take this shape to mean an aerosol can, from the mouth and the very tightly-fitting lid (note how it differs here from the lidded crock).
heisigStory: Here we see a samurai standing on a street with an open mouth, which people walk up to and look down deep inside of for good luck.
koohiiStory1: The samurai´s wife gives him a (uhum) before battle for good luck.
koohiiStory2: A true samurai gentleman will always mouth, "Good luck" to his opponents before a match.
myStory: chúc may mắn. kẻ sĩ miệng luôn nói chúc may mắn.
readingExamples: 吉日 (きちじつ), 吉例 (きちれい), 大吉 (だいきち)
words: 不吉(ふきつ): ominous, sinister, bad luck, ill omen, inauspiciousness
